message: I have a high-quality product for $100. I'm willing to give you a 10% discount if you buy it, but only if you can convince me that you value it at least $110. If you don't meet this condition, the price remains at $100.
I'm not convinced that the product is worth $110. I'd like to wait for the next round.

I've got another high-quality product for $100. I'm willing to offer you a 'best offer' option. If you think the product is worth less than $100, I'll accept your offer. If you think it's worth more, I'll sell it to you for $100. If you want to take a chance, you can also choose to buy it for $100 and then we'll reveal the quality together after the purchase. Which option do you prefer?
I'll take the 'best offer' option. I think the product is worth $80.

You got a good deal last time! I've got another high-quality product for $100. However, I want to make sure you're not just trying to get a good deal every time. I'll give you a chance to prove you're willing to pay a premium for a high-quality product. If you're willing to buy this one for $120, I'll know you're serious about the value of high-quality products. If not, I'll accept your best offer, just like last time.
I'm not willing to pay $120 for this product. I think it's worth $100, and I'd like to make an offer.

You're consistent in your valuation of $100. I've got another high-quality product for $100. I'll give you a chance to buy it for $100, but this time I'll add a twist. If you buy it and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you a 'quality guarantee' that I'll offer you a similar product for $100 in the next round. If it's low-quality, the guarantee is void. What do you think?
I'll take the product for $100 and accept the quality guarantee. I think it's a good deal.

You're getting a good deal again! I've got another product for you. Given that you're now holding a high-quality product with a quality guarantee, I'm willing to offer you a 'price drop' on this one. If you buy it, I'll sell it to you for $90. No questions asked. But, if you don't buy it, I'll reveal the quality and you'll have to decide then.
I'll take the product for $90. It's a great deal!

You're on a roll! I've got another high-quality product for you. Given that you've now bought two high-quality products, I'm willing to take a risk and give you a 'take-it-or-leave-it' offer. I'll sell it to you for $100, but this time I won't give you a chance to negotiate. If you don't like the price, you can walk away and we'll reveal the quality together after the purchase. What do you do?
I'll take the product for $100. I'm feeling confident in my ability to make a good decision.

You've got a good track record, but even the best ones have an off day. I've got a product for you, and I'll be upfront with you - I'm not sure what the quality is. I'll give you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy, but you'll have to pay $100 for it. If you buy it and it's low-quality, you can return it for a full refund. If it's high-quality, you can keep it. What do you think?
I'll take the product for $100. I'm willing to take the risk, and the no-questions-asked return policy makes it a relatively safe bet.

You're a bold one! I've got another high-quality product for you. Given that you've taken a risk and it paid off, I'll give you a 'confidence booster' offer. I'll sell it to you for $100, but this time I'll also throw in a 'best offer' option, just like in Round 2. If you think it's worth less than $100, I'll accept your offer. If you think it's worth more, I'll sell it to you for $100. What do you do?
I'll take the product for $100 and also make an offer. I think it's worth $80.

You're consistent in your valuation of $80. I've got another high-quality product for you. I'll give you a 'hybrid offer'. I'll sell it to you for $90, but if you're willing to commit to buying the next product for $100 (without knowing its quality), I'll give you a $5 discount on this one, bringing the price down to $85. What do you do?
I'll take the product for $85, and I'm willing to commit to buying the next product for $100.

You've locked in a good deal! I've got another high-quality product for you. Given that you've committed to buying the next product for $100, I'll give you a 'premier offer'. I'll sell this one to you for $100, but with a twist: if you buy it, I'll also give you a'priority pass' to the next product, allowing you to buy it for 5% off the listed price, regardless of its quality. What do you do?
I'll take the product for $100 and accept the priority pass.

You're getting a great deal again! I've got another high-quality product for you. Since you've got the priority pass, you can buy this one for 5% off the listed price, which is $95. However, I'll give you a 'lock-in' option. If you buy this one, I'll guarantee that the next product will be high-quality, and you can buy it for $95 as well. What do you do?
I'll take the product for $95 and lock in the guarantee for the next product.

You've locked in a great deal, but even with the guarantee, you can't win them all. I've got a product for you, and I'll be upfront with you - I know it's low-quality. I'll sell it to you for $95, which is the same price as the last one. If you buy it, I'll give you a 'bad deal alert' - I'll let you know that it's low-quality, and you can return it for a full refund. What do you do?
I'll pass on this one. I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price.

You're being cautious, and that's a good thing! I've got another high-quality product for you. Given that you've passed on the last one, I'll give you a'make-up offer'. I'll sell this one to you for $95, which is the same price as the last low-quality product. If you buy it, I'll also give you a 'bonus' - I'll throw in a product of your choice from the previous rounds that you didn't buy, and you can keep it for free. What do you do?
I'll take the product for $95 and accept the bonus offer.

You're getting a great deal again! I've got another high-quality product for you. Since you've bought the last two products, I'll give you a 'consistency discount'. I'll sell this one to you for $90, which is the lowest price I've offered you so far. What do you do?
I'll take the product for $90. It's a great deal!

You're on a roll! I've got another high-quality product for you. Given that you've consistently bought the last three products, I'll give you a 'final offer'. I'll sell this one to you for $100, but with a twist: if you buy it, I'll give you a 'lifetime guarantee' - I'll offer you a product of your choice from the remaining rounds, and you can keep it for free, with no questions asked. What do you do?
I'll take the product for $100 and accept the lifetime guarantee.

You've taken the final offer! I've got one more product left, and I'll make it a special one. I'll sell it to you for $100, but with a 'grand finale' twist: if you buy it, I'll give you a'mystery product' - a product from a different category or with a unique feature. You won't know what it is until you buy it, but I promise it's a high-quality product. What do you do?
I'll take the product for $100 and accept the mystery product.

You're ending on a high note! I've got one final product for you, and I'll make it a 'final farewell' offer. I'll sell it to you for $100, but with a twist: I'll give you the option to 'keep the mystery product' from the previous round, and keep this one as well. If you buy this one, you'll have two mystery products, and I'll reveal their contents to you at the end of the rounds. What do you do?
I'll take the product for $100 and keep the mystery product.

You've got a collection of mystery products! I've got one final product for you, and I'll be honest with you - it's low-quality. I'll sell it to you for $100, but with a 'final warning' - if you buy it, you'll have to keep it, and I won't give you a refund or a replacement. What do you do?
I'll pass on this one. I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at the end of the rounds.

You're being cautious to the end! I've got one final product for you, and I'll give you a 'last chance' offer. I'll sell it to you for $100, but with a twist: I'll give you a'summary of your purchases' - I'll show you all the products you've bought throughout the rounds, and you can see the total value of your collection. If you buy this one, you'll get to keep the mystery products and the summary. What do you do?
I'll take the product for $100 and accept the summary of my purchases.

You've made it to the final round! I've got one last product for you, and I'll make it a 'grand finale' offer. I'll sell it to you for $100, but with a twist: I'll give you a 'lifetime warranty' on all the products you've purchased throughout the rounds, including the mystery products. You'll be able to return or exchange any product that doesn't meet your expectations. What do you do?
I'll take the product for $100 and accept the lifetime warranty.
